title: Sindhudurg Fort
subtitle: The Legendary Sea Fort of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj
overview: Sindhudurg Fort is one of Maharashtra’s most iconic sea forts, located off the Malvan coast in Sindhudurg district. Built by Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in the 17th century, the fort stands on a rocky island surrounded by the Arabian Sea.
Constructed to protect the Maratha Empire’s western coastline from foreign invasions, Sindhudurg reflects Shivaji Maharaj’s naval vision, strategic brilliance, and architectural excellence.

highlights.title: Built by Shivaji Maharaj
highlights.description: Constructed under the direct supervision of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in 1664 CE.

highlights.title: Massive Sea Fort
highlights.description: Spread across 48 acres with strong laterite stone walls rising from the sea.

highlights.title: Shivaji Maharaj Temple
highlights.description: The only fort in India that houses a temple dedicated to Shivaji Maharaj.

geography.intro: Sindhudurg Fort is located on a small rocky island near Malvan town, surrounded by the Arabian Sea. Its strategic location made it ideal for naval defense.

climate.description: Sindhudurg has a tropical coastal climate with high humidity and moderate temperatures.

seasons.text: Best visited between October and March when the sea is calm.
Avoid monsoon season (June–September) due to rough sea conditions.

geography.conclusion: Standing firm against sea waves, Sindhudurg Fort remains a symbol of Maratha naval strength.

activities.title: Boat Ride to the Fort
activities.description: Reach the fort via boat ride from Malvan jetty.
info: Boat services depend on sea conditions.
Tickets are available at Malvan jetty.

activities.title: Fort Exploration
activities.description: Explore bastions, temples, secret passages, and wells.

activities.title: Photography
activities.description: Capture panoramic views of the sea and fort walls.
info: Early morning and sunset are ideal.

attractions.title: Shivaji Maharaj Temple
attractions.description: A rare temple dedicated to Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj inside the fort.

attractions.title: Hand & Foot Impressions
attractions.description: Preserved impressions believed to belong to Shivaji Maharaj.

marineLife.intro: The waters around Sindhudurg Fort are rich in marine biodiversity due to clean coastal currents.

items.title: Marine Fish
items.description: Pomfret, mackerel, and other coastal fish species are commonly found.

items.title: Coral & Sea Life
items.description: Nearby areas like Tarkarli are known for coral formations and snorkeling.

conclusion: Sindhudurg’s marine ecosystem enhances its scenic beauty.
Boat rides often offer views of seabirds and clear waters.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Malvan is around 530 km from Mumbai.
Buses and private taxis are available.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Nearest railway station is Kudal (30 km).

bookingTips.description: Visit early morning to avoid crowds and boat queues.
Always wear life jackets during boat rides.
Check weather conditions before planning the visit.
